Package org.forgerock.openidm.core

Class IdentityServer

java.lang.Object
org.forgerock.openidm.core.IdentityServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyAccessor
public final class IdentityServer extends Object implements PropertyAccessor
This class defines the core of the Identity Server.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static IdentityServer getInstance()

    • initInstance

      public static IdentityServer initInstance(PropertyAccessor properties)
      Initialise the singleton IdentityServer instance with the provided PropertyAccessor instance.

      This or the initInstance(IdentityServer) method can be called only once and then it throws IllegalStateException if it's called more then once.

      Parameters:
      properties - the parent PropertyAccessor
      Returns:
      new instance of IdentityServer
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when this method called more then once.

    • initInstance

      public static IdentityServer initInstance(IdentityServer server)
      Initialise the singleton IdentityServer instance with the provided IdentityServer instance.

      This or the initInstance(PropertyAccessor) method can be called only once and then it throws IllegalStateException if it's called more then once.

      Parameters:
      server - new instance of IdentityServer
      Returns:
      same instance as the server parameter if not null or the current instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when this method called more then once.

    • getProperty

      public <T> T getProperty(String key, T defaultValue, Class<T> expected)
      Retrieves the property value by looking in System properties, boot properties, and then config properties.
      Specified by:
      getProperty in interface PropertyAccessor
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type bound to the returned value.
      Parameters:
      key - The name of the requested property.
      defaultValue - the value returned if not found in the propertyAccessors.
      expected - the expected class of the returned value.
      Returns:
      The value of the stored property if found, else the defaultValue.

    • getProperty

      public String getProperty(String name, String defaultValue, boolean withPropertySubstitution)
      Retrieves the property with the specified name (case insensitvie). The check will first be made in the boot properties file, the local config properties, but if no value is found then the JVM system properties will be checked.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the property to retrieve.
      defaultValue - the default value to return if the property is not set
      withPropertySubstitution - whether to use boot and system property substitution
      Returns:
      The property with the specified name, or defaultValue if no such property is defined.

    • getProperty

      public String getProperty(String name, String defaultValue)
      Retrieves the property with the specified name (case insensitvie). The check will first be made in the boot properties file, the local config properties, but if no value is found then the JVM system properties will be checked.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the property to retrieve.
      defaultValue - the default value to return if the property is not set
      Returns:
      The property with the specified name, or defaultValue if no such property is defined.

    • getProperty

      public String getProperty(String name)
      Retrieves the property with the specified name (case insensitvie). The check will first be made in the local config properties, the boot properties file, but if no value is found then the JVM system properties will be checked.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the property to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The property with the specified name, or null if no such property is defined.

      Retrieves the path to the root directory for this instance of the Identity Server.

      public String getNodeName()

    • getFileForPath

      public static File getFileForPath(String path)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the specified path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the Identity Server root.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.

    • getFileForInstallPath

      public static File getFileForInstallPath(String path)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the Install path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the Install location.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.

    • getFileForProjectPath

      public static File getFileForProjectPath(String path)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the Project path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the Project location.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.

    • getFileForWorkingPath

      public static File getFileForWorkingPath(String path)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the Working path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the Working location.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.

    • getFileForPath

      public static File getFileForPath(String path, String serverRoot)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the specified path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the Identity Server root.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      serverRoot - the server root to resolve against
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.

    • getFileForPath

      public static File getFileForPath(String path, File rootLocation)
      Retrieves a File object corresponding to the specified path. If the given path is an absolute path, then it will be used. If the path is relative, then it will be interpreted as if it were relative to the rootLocation parameter.
      Parameters:
      path - The path string to be retrieved as a File
      rootLocation - the server root to resolve against
      Returns:
      A File object that corresponds to the specified path.
